posts.name: Murilo Miranda Santos
posts.cooked:
good morning! my FRC team is trying do this: Captura de tela 2025-04-26 175007 800×485 379 KB

Captura de tela 2025-04-26 175007 800×485 379 KB

Captura de tela 2025-04-26 175007 800×485 379 KB

Someone know which program the Orbit 1690 use?

posts.name: Arnav Ranjan
posts.cooked: Not sure what Orbit uses exactly, but our team uses elastic to do something similar. It would probably work for your use case.

Orbit made their own custom dashboard which AFAIK isn’t public. However there are a bunch of public dashboards out there that you can use. I personally recommend using Elastic as it is very easy to set up and has a wide variety of widgets. You can find more info about it here:

Elastic is a simple and modern dashboard made by Team 353. It is meant to be used behind the glass as a competition driver dashboard, but it can also be used for testing. It was built with the goal...

posts.name: Omer Prag
posts.cooked: As mentioned before, we use a custom dashboard which is not public. It’s written in Flutter, mainly to match all the other non-robot projects on our team

posts.name: Murilo Miranda Santos
posts.cooked: Thanks for the answer! But I have a question. How can I create an interactive box in Elastic? Can I create a box where I can choose an option from among others in a list?

posts.name: CJ Brandi
posts.cooked: Something like that, you usually have to put in your robot’s code. There is documentation on how to make a selectable interface.
Yes. You can use the ComboBox chooser widget. The docs for it are here .
